image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from Kentucky; born near Scottsville, Allen County, Ky., January 31, 1849; attended the common schools; moved to Franklin, Ky., in 1870; was graduated from Cumberland University, Lebanon, Tenn., in 1872, and afterwards attended the law department of the same university; was admitted to the bar in 1873 and commenced practice in Franklin; member of the State house of representatives in 1877 and 1878; chairman of the Democratic State convention at Louisville, Ky., in 1891; elected as a Democrat to the Fifty-first, Fifty-second, and Fifty-third Congresses (March 4, 1889-March 3, 1895); was not a candidate for renomination in 1894; elected judge of the seventh Kentucky circuit in 1897 and served until his death in Franklin, Ky., July 24, 1901; interment in Green Lawn Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: In the Goodnight Family Papers, ca. 1841-1976, 0.4 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: The collection of Goodnight family papers includes correspondence, photographs, and other documents related to the family, their activities, and the Goodnight Memorial Library. Four photograph albums contain pictures of the Goodnights and of Ella Goodnight's parents, Thomas and Lucy Hoy. Other photographs show various houses owned by members of the Goodnight family. Other materials include a copy of Ella Goodnight's will, correspondence and newsclippings relating to Herschel Goodnight's political career, and genealogical information about the Goodnight family. Materials concerning the library include photographs of the interior and newsclippings about activities.

researchRecord.name: ca. 1849-1901, 0.4 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Isaac Herschel Goodnight include photographs, tax receipts, deeds, a manuscript about his life, two letters to Isaac Herschel Goodnight from William Jennings Bryan concerning Isaac Herschel Goodnight's support for William Jennings Bryan's 1896 presidential campaign, and some family materials.
